Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cecropin B (Cecropin B1; natural AMPs; UCLL1, BmCecB; insects,  arthropods, invertebrates, animals; Cecropin B2: XXK)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Lethal concentration=LC: Active against P. fluorescens (LC 1.6 uM), X. campestris (LC 1.2 uM), C. iodinum (LC 0.85 uM), A. tumefaciens (LC 0.41 uM),  A. aecalis (LC 0.49 uM), A. polymorph (LC 1.8 uM), E. coli KI2 (LC 0.38 uM), S. marcescens (LC 0.67 uM), M. luteus (LC 0.59 uM), B. ammoniagenes (LC 0.49 uM), L. plantarum (LC 0.62 uM), A. simplex (LC 0.46 uM), B. subtilis (LC 3.6 uM), and B. sphaericus (LC 4.4 uM).Chemical modification:  Note that cecropins B1 and B2 are identical except for the lysine at position 21, where it is a normal lysine in B2, but a hydroxylated in B1 (XXK).Updated 8/2020; 12/2024 GW
Literature Information.Author: Morishima I, Suginaka S, Ueno T, Hirano H.1990
Literature Information.Title: Isolation and structure of cecropins, inducible antibacterial peptides, from the silkworm, Bombyx mori.
